Reason: The _journalSizeThreshold configuration determines the threshold size at which the system will trigger a journal rotation. A lower threshold may result in more frequent journal rotations, leading to increased disk I/O operations and potentially impacting system performance. Conversely, a higher threshold may delay journal rotations, potentially causing increased memory consumption as the journal grows larger. Therefore, changes in the _journalSizeThreshold value can significantly affect system performance, making it a performance-sensitive configuration.
